original_content:
Running a Raspberry Pi with solar power sounds easy. Of course, like most things, the details are what get you. About a year ago, [Bystroushaa] tried it without success. But the second time turned out to be the charm.
Of course, success is a relative term. It does work, but there is concern that it wont be sufficient in the winter. In addition, if the battery dies, everything doesnt restart automatically. Still, it is usable, and there should be ways to solve those problems.
The original attempt used a PiJuice hat and solar panel. This time, the design didnt use these, opting instead for a LiFePO4 battery, a solar regulator, and a solar panel. The rest of it comes down to mechanical and physical mounting. The cheap regulator has some drawbacks. For example, it doesnt allow for monitoring like more expensive units. It also cannot balance the cells periodically, although that could be done with an external controller.
Weve seen solar-powered Pi boards before. Or, try a Game Boy.
title: ラズベリーパイで太陽光発電を試す：成功の秘訣とは？
body: ラズベリーパイを太陽光で稼働させる方法を紹介。以前に失敗したが、今回は成功。ただし、冬には不十分かもしれず、バッテリーの充電がなくなると自動的に再起動しない。しばらくは使えるが、問題解決が必要。安価なレギュレーターはモニタリングができないなど欠点あり。太陽光で動くラズベリーパイは以前から存在。
